column4: Hi - I am having probs with a driver and it is saying that i am missing a file - please help and look at my pastebin http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/41744/
Hi - I am having probs with a driver and it is saying that i am missing a file - please help and look at my pastebin http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/41744/
check if there's a symlink from 'linux' to the kernel headers dir in /usr/src
- I don;t understand that as I am new to this - please help
get a terminal : cd /usr/src , then ln -s linux linux-headers-`uname`
get a terminal : cd /usr/src , then ln -s linux linux-headers-`uname -r`
put a sudo befor the ln -s ...
- is that it? do I carry on where i left off before?
- I am getting the same message
- I am getting the same message

then indeed the build needs the full kernel source... so you have to sudo apt-get install linux-source, then unpack the archive in /usr/src and adjust the symlink 'linux' to point on the unpacked kernel source
- I have downloaded the linux source - can you help me link please
you need to unpack the archive in /usr/src
- I am unpacking and just loads of cannot open: no such file or directory
- please have a look at this - what is going on?! http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/41754/
are you running out of memory or /tmp space ?
- it's all fresh install so I should have loads of space
